msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; the name of King ʾIyasu, of the scribe and of ʾabba Sälama in fol. 99rc. A few lines (5), divided into groups alternating with black lines, on the incipit page of Texts I-1 and I-5, and on the incipit page of “Raʾǝyä Yoḥannǝs” (in Text I-9); headings and incipits of the texts, their sections and subsections (sometimes with a few alternating black lines); titles of the Biblical books and other works; directives for the ministers in Text I-7; names of Hebrew letters in Text I-8; the words: yǝbe mätärgwǝm in Texts I-5 and I-6, ʿǝgziʾo täśähalännä in Text I-7, sǝbuḥänni in Text I-8, kiryalayson and its abbreviation in Text I-7. Some names and abbreviations in Additiones 4 and 5. Notes in the margins; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals; elements of the text dividers and of quire marks; coronis (fol. 70r).

msItem.note: - On fol. 99rc, the “Homily of Jacob of Serug on Abraham” (in Text I-8) ends with a subscriptio ascribing the translation of the homily (from Arabic into Gǝʿǝz) to Metropolitan ʾabba Sälama; besides, the original writing of the work is here attributed to Athanasius (Bishop of Alexandria from 328 to 373; cp. EAE I, 392): … ለዝንቱ፡ ድርሳን፡ ዘአጽሐፎ፡ አቡነ፡ አባ፡ ሰላማ፡ ጳጳስ፡ ርቱዓ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ እምዐረቢ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ዚአሁ፡ ለግዕዝ፤ ይተሉ፡ ዝየ፡ ተጽሕፎ፡ ዘይቤ፡ አባ፡ አትናስዮስ። (for the same note cp. Mss.AQG-004,GMS-001).

- On fols. 137va-138ra, the text ends with a long subscriptio in which the names of the commissioner of the Ms., King ʾIyasu, and the name of the scribe, Ṣǝge Dǝngǝl, are mentioned. The first part of the name Täklä Haymanot (a church? a personal name?) has been erased.
- Lacunae on fol. 62ra (spaces left for rubrications?).
- Compressed script over erasure on fol. 112ra.

- the number ፮ is with the loop open, looking like “compressed” ፯;
- the number ፪ has the bottom loop open;
- the number ፩ is triangular and upwards-oriented;
- the letters ጵ has the 6th order marker set up on the vertical stroke at the top, oriented to the left (esp. fol. 68rc l.5);
- the upper horizontal strokes of the letters መ ሠ, esp. in the 1st order, are slightly slanted to the left;

list.item:
Fols. 1v-2r, 138rc, 138va (in the bottom and upper margins), 139vb-140r: Record concerning land transaction (?). Fols. 1v: በዘመነ፡ ማርቆስ፡ ባፄ፡ ሣህሉ፡ መንግሥት፡ በቄስ፡ {አጼ፡} ገብረ፡ ማርያም፡ … በዘመነ፡ ማቴዎስ፡ በአፄ፡ ተክለ፡ ጊዮርጊስ፡ መንግሥት፡ በአቃቤ፡ ስዓት፡ … በዘመነ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ በአፄ፡ ሕዝቅያስ፡ መንግሥት፡ በአለቃ፡ ዜና፡ ቄስአጽነት፡ …
These notes cover some fols. in quire A (fols. 1v-2r) and in quire B (138rc, 138va, 139vb-140r). They are written by several hands in Amharic (a few words also in Gǝʿǝz). The notes are erased completely on fol. 140r, partly on fol. 139vc (at the top) and in the column c of fol. 138rc.
Fols. 138rb-138rc: Excerpt from a liturgical text.

Fol. 138va-vc: Record concerning tributes or land distribution (?).
The note is written in Amharic.

Fols. 139ra-rb: Sälam-hymns to Mary.
The words sälam (and its abbreviation säla), the name of Mary and elements of the punctuation signs are rubricated.

Fols. 139rc-139va: Hymns to God.
The words ʾIyäsus and säbḥat (and its abbreviation säb/säbḥa), some initial words and elements of the punctuation signs are rubricated.

- In the upper margin of fol. 3r a note mentions the original provenance of the Ms., which is the church of Mädḫane ʿAläm, (the church of Mäqdäla in Wällo; cp. EAE III, 763-65): Gäbrä ḥǝmamat zä-Qǝddus Mädḫane ʿAläm. - The name of the scribe Ṣǝge Dǝngǝl (in the genitive costruction zä-Ṣǝge Dǝngǝl, "of Ṣǝge Dǝngǝl") is written in the bottom margin of fol. 3r (decorated by red dots above and below), and within the text divider on fol. 82va. - The supplication to God, ʾIyäsus Krǝstos wäldä ʾǝgziʾabǝḥer ḥǝyaw täśahalännä, is written in red (encircled by dots) in the upper margin of fols. 3r, 12v, 15v, 28v, 30v, 42r, 45r, 57r, 82v, and within the frame of the text divider on fol. 73ra. - Excerpts of hymns for the Good Friday (?) are written in red (decorated by dots and thin lines above and below) in the upper margins of fols. 88r, 88v, 89r, 94v, 95r, 103v, 104r, 109v, 110r. - Numbers (cues for the rubricator) are written in the left margin of the columns repeating the rubricated numbers in the text columns (e.g., fols. 4r, 6r). - Immediate correction (?) marked by dots above and below: e.g., fols. 10va, 10vc, 105va. - Pen trials in fol. 140v. - An unclear note, in black ink and by a secondary hand, is written in the upper margin of fol. 62r. - The title of the Ms., in Latin script as “Gebre H[n.l.]mamāt”, and the number 834, are written in pencil (or faded ink) in fol. 1r.

origin.origDate: 1682-1706 or 1730-55. King ʾIyasu, mentioned in the supplication formulas throughout the Ms. and in the subscriptio at the end of the text can be King ʾIyasu I (r. 1682-1706) or ʾIyasu II (r. 1730-55).

person.persName: King ʾIyasu is mentioned as the commissioner of the Ms. in a subscriptio at the end of the text (fol. 137va l.2). His name is also written in the supplication formulas throughout the Ms. It is not clear whether it is meant King ʾIyasu I (r. 1682-1706) or ʾIyasu II (r. 1730-55).
The Ms. originally belonged to the church of Mädḫane ʿAläm (Mäqdäla in Wällo; cp. EAE III, 763-65); s. fol. 3r (upper margin).
